summary: Lets you browse offline html docs in a buffer
name: Lynx-Offline-Documentation-Browser
description:
Inspired by the Info browser script, I present this script for bowsing html documentaion offline in a vim buffer via lynx. 

:Lynx index.html will create your buffer, then browsing is a matter of using the usual "tag" keys Ctrl-] and Ctrl-T. A link is indicated by lynx as a number in square brackets. Place the cursor over this (on the '[') and use Ctrl-] to follow the link.

It probably could be tidied up and also follow http: links as well as file: links but this is all I need to browse the wxPython docs offline which was what I wrote it for. Improvements welcome.

This has been tested on a Slackware 9.1 box with Vim 6.2. YMMV.
install_details: Put it in your vim plugins directory ....
